column4: does anyone know of a utility that will tell you what the most recently written files are on your system?
the places find can find files larger than any defined size..
places find?
keep in mind I can't install any new programs till I find this stuff and delete it
pull down menu.. places.. then find.. then options
this in gnome?
yes
places..search..
nautilus, or gnome menu?
I'm in E17... so gnome stuff is harder
what command is it actually running?
Sorry, I thought this was Ubuntu..
this is Ubuntu, E17 is a window manager
I know what e17 is... thanks..
there is no utility I can use via xterm to find directories in / above 1GB?
You might try running live cd?
that will do what?
I am not much of a cli guy
Give you access to the search function for files over 1 gig
I still *have* gnome
thanks, I found out that wine had spewed gigabytes of log info into kern.log.0 and syslog.0
Glad you got it..
